item.title: Isa add a quote by Stacia Kane
item.description:
"NO reader has ANY obligation to an author, whether it be to leave a review or to write a "constructive" one. I put out a product. You are consumers of that product. Since when does that mean you have to kiss my ass? Hey, I like Pop-Tarts and eat them a few times a year; since when does that mean I'm obligated to support Kellogg's in any way except legally purchasing the Pop-Tarts before I eat them? I wasn't aware that purchasing and consuming a product meant I was under some sort of fucking thrall in which I'm only allowed to either praise the Pop-Tart (which to be honest isn't hard, especially the S'mores flavor) or, if I am going to criticize a flavor, offer a specific and detailed analysis as to why, phrased in as inoffensive and gentle a manner as possible so as not to upset the gentle people at Kellogg's."
[<i>Something in the Water?</i> (blog post; January 9, 2012)]" -- Stacia Kane

item.title: Isa add a quote by Wodehouse
Isa add a quote by Patricia A. McKillip
item.description: "It’s an odd thing, happiness. Some people take happiness from gold. Or black pearls. And some of us, far more fortunate, take their happiness from periwinkles." -- Patricia A. McKillip

item.title: Isa add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I don't want whatever I want. Nobody does. Not really. What kind of fun would it be if I just got everything I ever wanted just like that, and it didn't mean anything? What then?" -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Isa add a quote by Fernando Pessoa
item.description: "There are ships sailing to many ports, but not a single one goes where life is not painful." -- Fernando Pessoa

item.title: Isa add a quote by Diana Wynne Jones
item.description: "Don’t interrupt,’ one of the boys said. ‘He’ll lose his life.’ Seeing it was a matter of life and death, Sophie and Michael backed toward the door. But Howl, quite unperturbed at killing his nephew, strode over to the wall and pulled the boxes up by the roots." -- Diana Wynne Jones

item.title: Isa add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "The Road goes ever on and on Down from the door where it began. Now far ahead the Road has gone, And I must follow, if I can, Pursuing it with eager feet, Until it joins some larger way Where many paths and errands meet. And whither then? I cannot say" -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Isa add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "but for my own part, if a book is well written, I always find it too short." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Isa add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Only dull people are brilliant at breakfast." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Isa add a quote by Eça de Queirós
item.description: "Procrastinare lusitanum est" -- Eça de Queirós

item.title: Isa add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "A European says: I can't understand this, what's wrong with me? An American says: I can't understand this, what's wrong with him? I make no suggestion that one side or other is right, but observation over many years leads me to believe it is true." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Isa add a quote by Sarah Rees Brennan
item.description: "Hark,” he said, his tone very dry. “What stone through yonder window breaks?” Kami yelled up at him, “It is the east, and Juliet is a jerk!” Jared abandoned Shakespeare and demanded, “What do you think you’re doing?” “Throwing a pebble,” said Kami defensively. “Uh… and I’ll pay for the window.” Jared vanished and Kami was ready to start shouting again, when he reemerged with the pebble clenched in his fist. “This isn’t a pebble! This is a <i>rock</i>.” “It’s possible that your behaviour has inspired some negative feelings that caused me to pick a slightly overlarge pebble,” Kami admitted." -- Sarah Rees Brennan

item.title: Isa add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "You love me. Real or not real?" I tell him, "Real." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Isa add a quote by Claire Legrand
item.description: "But it's hard to leave a place when you're tied to it by fear, when it's broken you with fear, when it's all you've ever known." -- Claire Legrand

item.title: Isa add a quote by Franny Billingsley
item.description: "Yes, I'm shallow, I don't mind admitting it. Perhaps I should admit that there's no end to the depths of my shallowness." -- Franny Billingsley

item.title: Isa add a quote by Ysabeau S. Wilce
item.description: "Most courage comes from being too tired and hungry to be afraid anymore." -- Ysabeau S. Wilce

item.title: Isa add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "You forget what you want to remember, and you remember what you want to forget." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Isa add a quote by Courtney Summers
Isa add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Monsters are real, and ghosts are real too. They live inside us, and sometimes, they win." -- Stephen King

item.title: Isa add a quote by Angela Carter
item.description: "Reading a book is like re-writing it for yourself. You bring to a novel, anything you read, all your experience of the world. You bring your history and you read it in your own terms." -- Angela Carter

item.title: Isa add a quote by Cassandra Rose Clarke
Isa add a quote by Marissa Meyer
item.description: "But you're the only one, Scarlet. You'll always be the only one." -- Marissa Meyer
